Island Map¶

The island_map module¶

This module provides the class for implementing the island.

class biosim.island_map.IslandMap(island_geography, initial_population)[source]¶

Implements the island map. Map has one cell per location, represented by instances of landscape types. There are several seasons for the animals on the island, e.g. for feeding and procreating, and all seasons run from the Island Map class.

Initialize map class with given island geography and initial population of the various cells.

Parameters:
  • island_geography (multiline str) – Specifies island geography
  • initial_population (list of dicts) – Specifies initial population of each cell
add_population(population)[source]¶

Adds a new population to the already existing population of the island, in a manner similar to create_population_dict.

Parameters:population (list of dicts) – Specifies the new population of one or more cells
aging_season()[source]¶

Iterates through all landscape cells on the map, and makes all animals in each cell older.

check_boundaries_are_ocean()[source]¶

Checks that all boundary cells for the map are Ocean.

Raises:ValueError – if a boundary cell is other landscape type than Ocean
check_map_lines_have_equal_length()[source]¶

Checks that all lines in the map’s geography string are of equal length.

Raises:ValueError – if lines in map str are more than one length
create_geography_dict()[source]¶

Converts geography string to a dictionary with coordinates as keys and the landscape types as values. Coordinates are a tuple of x and y coordinates.

create_map_dict()[source]¶

Iterates through geography dictionary and creates a new dictionary of the entire map. This dict has coordinates as keys and instances of landscape classes as values. Each landscape instance has the population list of it’s coordinate as input.

Raises:ValueError – if invalid landscape type is given in geography string
create_population_dict()[source]¶

Converts list of populations to a dictionary with coordinates as keys and lists of the properties of the animals at this location as values.

dying_season()[source]¶

Iterates through all landscape cells on the map, and removes all dead animals in each cell.

feeding_season()[source]¶

Iterates through all landscape cells on the map, and feeds all herbivores and carnivores in each cell.

migration_season()[source]¶

Iterates through all landscape cells on the map, and moves all animals in each cell.

move_all_animals_in_cell(current_coordinates, current_landscape)[source]¶

Iterates through the population lists of a cell. Attempts to move all animals, and updates animal population lists if an animal moved.

Parameters:
  • current_coordinates (tuple) – x coordinate, y coordinate
  • current_landscape (class instance) – Landscape type of current cell
move_single_animal(current_coordinates, single_animal)[source]¶

If the animal has not moved so far this year, it’s neighbours are found. Then, the new coordinates of the animal is chosen. If they are None, the animal does not move. If they are a tuple, the animal is moved to the chosen cell. The new cell gets updated population lists.

Parameters:
  • current_coordinates (tuple) – x coordinate, y coordinate
  • single_animal (class instance) – Either herbivore or carnivore that tries to move
Returns:

True if animal has moved, False if not
Return type:

bool
neighbours_of_current_cell(current_coordinates)[source]¶

Finds all neighbouring coordinates of a given cell. Checks the landscape type of each coordinate. The neighbours with landscape types an animal can move to, are returned.

Parameters:current_coordinates (tuple) – Location of current cell
Returns:locations as keys and landscape class instance as values
Return type:dict
procreation_season()[source]¶

Iterates through all landscape cells on the map, and tries to procreate with all animals in each cell.

run_all_seasons()[source]¶

Runs all seasons for all landscape cells on the map.

weight_loss_season()[source]¶

Iterates through all landscape cells on the map, and makes all animals in each cell lose weight.
